parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.05

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.55

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Terminates the effect in the given layer by fading it out according to the given duration. If named layer is used and it doesn't exist, it will be allocated. For title layer see [[titleFadeOut]].
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>For greater efficiency and ease of moddability, it is recommended to use named layers.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> layer '''cutFadeOut''' duration

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> layer: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> duration: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> layerName '''cutFadeOut''' duration <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.57.134673</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> layerName: [[String]] - effect layer name. Layer names are CaSe SeNsItIvE

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> duration: [[Number]] - fade out time

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Number]] - number of the corresponding layer

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>0 [[cutFadeOut]] 2;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_layer = "layer1" [[cutFadeOut]] 2;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allCutLayers]], [[cutText]], [[cutRsc]], [[cutObj]], [[allActiveTitleEffects]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 9, 2016 - 11:30 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Krzmbrzl00|Krzmbrzl00]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.60</value></part></template> The actual fadeOut-duration can be dependent on the duration for the fadeIn (e.g. specified by [[cutText]]). If the fadeIn-duration is set to a value less than 1 the fadeOut-duration will be the given number multiplied by the fadeIn-duration.
<code>"test" [[cutText]] ["", "BLACK", 0.5, [[true]]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>fadein is < 0</value></part></template>
"test" [[cutFadeOut]] 2; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>The actual fadeout-time is 2 * 0.5 <template><title>=</title></template> 1</value></part></template></code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
